animals.name: Blue Jay
description: Vibrant songbird native to North America, noted for bold crests and blue plumage.
Omnivorous diet of acorns, seeds, and insects; known for caching food.
Intelligent and social; can mimic hawk calls.

animals.name: Owl
description: Nocturnal raptors with silent flight and exceptional hearing.
Hunt small mammals and insects; forward-facing eyes aid depth perception.

animals.name: Eagle
description: Large birds of prey with powerful talons and keen eyesight.
Often nest on cliffs or tall trees; diet includes fish and small mammals.

animals.name: Lion
description: Social big cats living in prides; iconic roars travel kilometers.
Hunt ungulates like zebra and wildebeest on African savannas.

animals.name: Tiger
description: Solitary apex predators of Asian forests and grasslands.
Striped coats provide camouflage; powerful swimmers.

animals.name: Elephant
description: Largest land mammals; complex social structures and long lifespans.
Use infrasonic rumbles to communicate over distance.

animals.name: Wolf
description: Pack-living canids known for howling and cooperative hunting.
Inhabit forests, tundra, and mountains across the Northern Hemisphere.

animals.name: Crocodile
description: Ambush predators of tropical rivers and wetlands; powerful jaws.
Feed on fish, birds, and mammals near water.

animals.name: Snake
description: Limbless reptiles with flexible jaws; occupy diverse habitats.
Diet varies widely from rodents to birds and amphibians.

animals.name: Turtle
description: Reptiles with bony shells; live in oceans, freshwater, and on land.
Some species migrate great distances to nest.

animals.name: Chameleon
description: Change color for communication and thermoregulation; projectile tongues.
Independently moving eyes aid in predator detection.

animals.name: Frog
description: Permeable skin and jumping legs; metamorphose from tadpoles.
Calls attract mates and defend territories near water.

animals.name: Salamander
description: Tailed amphibians found in moist habitats; many regenerate limbs.
Diet includes insects, worms, and small invertebrates.

animals.name: Newt
description: Semi-aquatic salamanders with smooth skin; split time between water and land.
Reproduction typically involves aquatic eggs and larvae.

animals.name: Clownfish
description: Bright orange fish living symbiotically with sea anemones.
Found in warm Indo-Pacific reefs; omnivorous diet.

animals.name: Goldfish
description: Domesticated carp popular in aquariums and ponds.
Varieties exhibit diverse colors, fins, and body shapes.

animals.name: Shark
description: Cartilaginous fish with multiple rows of teeth; apex predators.
Excellent senses detect faint electrical fields.

animals.name: Salmon
description: Anadromous fish migrating from ocean to rivers to spawn.
Important ecological and cultural species in the North Atlantic and Pacific.

animals.name: Butterfly
description: Insects with scaled wings; complete metamorphosis from caterpillar to adult.
Important pollinators and ecological indicators.

animals.name: Bee
description: Vital pollinators; many species form complex social colonies.
Collect nectar and pollen; threatened by habitat loss and disease.

animals.name: Ladybug
description: Beneficial beetles that eat aphids; bright colors warn predators.
Common in gardens, fields, and forests worldwide.

animals.name: Bear
description: Omnivorous mammals with varied diets and habitats.
Some species hibernate during winter months.

animals.name: Kangaroo
description: Marsupials native to Australia with powerful hind legs.
Females carry joeys in a pouch until developed.

animals.name: Dolphin
description: Intelligent marine mammals with complex social behavior.
Communicate using clicks and whistles.

animals.name: Zebra
description: Equids recognized by bold black-and-white stripes.
Graze on tough grasses in African herds.

animals.name: Giraffe
description: Tallest land animals; browse treetops with long necks.
Often seen in small groups near acacias.

animals.name: Bat
description: Only mammals capable of sustained flight; vital ecological roles.
Many species use echolocation to navigate in the dark.

animals.name: Parrot
description: Social, intelligent birds known for vivid colors and vocal talents.
Common in tropical and subtropical regions.

animals.name: Crow
description: Highly intelligent birds capable of problem-solving and tool use.
Adaptable to rural and urban environments.

animals.name: Hummingbird
description: Tiny aerial acrobats with rapid wingbeats and hovering flight.
Often visit flowers for nectar and aid pollination.

animals.name: Penguin
description: Flightless seabirds adapted for life in the water.
Agile swimmers and skilled fish hunters.

animals.name: Flamingo
description: Recognizable by pink plumage and long legs; filter feeders.
Color comes from carotenoid pigments in their diet.

animals.name: Peacock
description: Famed for iridescent tail feathers used in courtship displays.
Often forage on the ground in forests and farmlands.

animals.name: Robin
description: Familiar garden birds with bright breasts and melodious songs.
Active foragers often seen hopping for insects.

animals.name: Lizard
description: Diverse reptiles found in deserts, forests, and urban areas.
Some species can detach their tails to escape predators.
